stmt.pretty: ineq12i(ran(c0), ran(c1), dom(`' c0), dom(`' c1))

body.origin:
|- wceq(cin(crn(c0), crn(c1)), cin(cdm(ccnv(c0)), cdm(ccnv(c1))))
-| wceq(crn(c0), cdm(ccnv(c0)))
-| wceq(crn(c1), cdm(ccnv(c1)))
body.pretty:
⊢ (ran(c0)⋂ ran(c1))=(dom(`' c0)⋂ dom(`' c1))
⊣ ran(c0)= dom(`' c0)
⊣ ran(c1)= dom(`' c1)

comment: The range of an intersection belongs the intersection of ranges. Theorem 9 of [Suppes] p. 60. (Contributed by NM, 15-Sep-2004.)
